post.description:
Delete the authenticated user's account.

**Important Notes:**
- This action is irreversible
- The user's phone number will be modified to prevent future logins
- The account will be deactivated
- No confirmation required - direct deletion

**Request Body:**
```json
{}
```

**Response:**
```json
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Account has been successfully deleted",
    "deleted_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z",
    "user_id": 123
}
```

Authenticate user with username and password to get JWT tokens.

**Legacy Authentication Method**: This endpoint is kept for backward compatibility.
New users should use phone-based authentication.

**Response**: Returns access token, refresh token, and user profile data.

application/json.detail: No active account found with the given credentials

post.summary: Send SMS Code for Phone Login
post.description: Send a 6-digit SMS verification code to the provided phone number for login.

Verify the SMS code and login with phone number.

**Development Note**: Use '081020' as the SMS code for testing.

**Rate Limiting**: Maximum 5 verification attempts per session with 5-minute lockout.

**Response**: 
- If user exists: Returns JWT tokens and user data
- If user doesn't exist: Returns registration_required flag

application/json.message: Phone number verified. Please complete registration.
Too many attempts! Try again in 5 minutes

get.description:
Retrieve the current authenticated user's profile information.

**Authentication Required**: This endpoint requires a valid JWT access token.

**Response**: Returns complete user profile including:
- Personal information (name, email, phone)
- Social media links (Instagram, Telegram)
- Avatar image URL
- Notification preferences
- Account status and dates

put.description:
Update the current authenticated user's profile information (full update).

**Authentication Required**: This endpoint requires a valid JWT access token.

**Full Update**: All fields should be provided for a complete update.
Use PATCH for partial updates instead.

patch.description:
Update the current authenticated user's profile information.

**Authentication Required**: This endpoint requires a valid JWT access token.

**Supported Updates**:
- Personal information (full name, email)
- Social media links (Instagram, Telegram)
- Avatar image upload
- Notification preferences

**File Upload**: Use multipart/form-data for avatar uploads.
Supported formats: JPG, PNG, GIF

**Partial Updates**: You can update only specific fields - all fields are optional.

post.description:
Refresh an expired access token using a valid refresh token.

**Usage**: When your access token expires (typically after 1 hour), use this endpoint
to get a new access token without requiring the user to login again.

**Token Expiry**: 
- Access tokens expire after 1 hour
- Refresh tokens expire after 7 days

Register a new user with verified phone number.

**Prerequisites**: 
- Phone number must be verified using SMS verification
- Valid session ID from SMS verification must be provided

**No Password Required**: Users authenticate via phone/SMS, not passwords.
A random password is generated automatically for system compatibility.

**Profile Information**: Users can provide optional profile information
including social media links and avatar image.

application/json.message: Phone not verified or verification expired

post.description:
Send a 6-digit SMS verification code to the provided phone number for user registration.

**Legacy Endpoint**: This endpoint is kept for backward compatibility.
For login, use the new phone-based authentication endpoints.

**Rate Limiting**: Maximum 3 SMS requests per phone number per minute.

**Phone Number Format**: Accepts various formats:
- +998901234567
- 998901234567
- +998 90 123 45 67
- 998 90 123 45 67

Verify the SMS code sent to the phone number for user registration.

**Legacy Endpoint**: This endpoint is kept for backward compatibility.
For login, use the new phone-based authentication endpoints.

**Session Management**: The session ID from the SMS send response must be provided.
The verification code expires after 5 minutes.

**Rate Limiting**: Maximum 5 verification attempts per session.

application/json.message: Too many attempts! Try again in 5 minutes

get.description:
Get a list of product categories with advanced filtering and caching.

## üéØ Key Features
- **Branch-specific filtering** - Filter categories by products available in specific branch
- **Performance optimized** - Uses caching and optimized queries
- **Hierarchical support** - Include nested children with configurable depth
- **Search functionality** - Search in category titles and slugs
- **Flexible ordering** - Order by various fields

## üîç Filtering Options

### üìç **Branch Filtering**
- `branch_id` - Filter categories that have products available in this branch
- Only returns categories with active products in the specified branch
- Optimized with subqueries for better performance

### üèóÔ∏è **Hierarchical Filtering**
- `parent` - Filter by parent category (null for root categories)
- `include_children` - Include nested children (true/false)
- `max_depth` - Maximum depth for nested children (default: 3)

### üîç **Search & Ordering**
- `search` - Search in title and slug fields
- `ordering` - Order by field (order, -order, id, -id, title, -title, etc.)

## ‚ö° Performance Features
- **Intelligent caching** - Results cached for 5 minutes based on query parameters
- **Optimized queries** - Uses select_related and prefetch_related
- **Subquery optimization** - Efficient branch filtering with minimal database hits
- **Smart counting** - Product counts reflect branch availability when filtered

## üìä Response Structure
Each category includes:
- Basic info (id, title, slug, icon, order)
- Hierarchical data (parent, children_count)
- Product counts (products_count - reflects branch filtering)
- Nested children (if include_children=true)

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search in title and slug fields

parameters.name: branch_id
parameters.description: Filter categories by products available in this branch

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: Filter by parent category ID (null for root categories)

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Order by field (order, -order, id, -id, title, -title, created_at, -created_at, children_count, -children_count, products_count, -products_count)

parameters.name: include_children
parameters.description: Include nested children (true/false)

parameters.name: max_depth
parameters.description: Maximum depth for nested children

get.summary: Reverse Geocoding - Get Address from Coordinates
get.description:
Get address information from latitude and longitude coordinates.

**Service**: Uses Nominatim geocoding service to convert coordinates to human-readable addresses.

**Response**: Returns structured address information including:
- Short address (concise format)
- Long address (full detailed format)
- ZIP/Postal code
- Street name

**Use Case**: Convert GPS coordinates to addresses for delivery locations.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Latitude coordinate (-90 to 90)

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Longitude coordinate (-180 to 180)

application/json.long_address: 12A, Amir Temur Street, Yunusabad District, Tashkent, Uzbekistan

latitude: Ensure this value is between -90 and 90.
longitude: Ensure this value is between -180 and 180.

get.description:
Search for address suggestions based on a query string.

**Service**: Uses Nominatim geocoding service to find matching addresses.

**Features**:
- Returns up to 5 relevant suggestions
- Limited to Uzbekistan locations
- Includes coordinates and formatted addresses

**Response**: Returns a list of address suggestions with:
- Latitude and longitude coordinates
- Formatted address string

**Use Case**: Auto-complete functionality for address input fields.

get.description:
Identify the processing source and vendor of a card based on its number.

**Purpose**: Determine card type and processing network for payment processing.

**Features**:
- Uses first 4-6 digits (BIN) for identification
- Supports multiple card types (HUMO, UZCARD, VISA, MASTERCARD, etc.)
- Fast lookup with optimized data structures
- No authentication required (public endpoint)

**Supported Card Types**:
- HUMO (HUMO, VISA, MASTERCARD)
- UZCARD (UZCARD, UNIONPAY, MIR, MASTERCARD)

**Use Case**: Payment form validation and card type detection.

**Note**: This endpoint only supports GET requests. Use the card_number query parameter.

parameters.description: Card number (at least 4 digits)

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

post.description: Accept an order for couriers.

Return products from an order by the authenticated courier.

**Business Rules:**
- Only orders assigned to the authenticated courier can have products returned
- Order must be in 'delivered' or 'out_for_delivery' status
- Returned quantity cannot exceed the ordered quantity for each item
- Returned quantity can be 0 (no return) up to the maximum ordered quantity
- Updates returned_quantity and returned_amount in OrderItem
- Updates refund_amount in Order (sum of all returned amounts)

**Validation:**
- SKU must exist in the order
- Returned quantity must be between 0 and ordered quantity
- All calculations are done in atomic transaction

**Response:**
- Success: Returns total refund amount and count of returned items
- Failure: Returns appropriate error message with details

value.message: This order is not assigned to you
Returned quantity (3) cannot exceed ordered quantity (2) for SKU ID 123
Product with SKU ID 123 not found in this order

post.description:
Upload multiple refund images for an order by the authenticated courier.

**Business Rules:**
- Only orders assigned to the authenticated courier can have refund images uploaded
- Order must be in 'delivered' or 'out_for_delivery' status
- Images are stored in the 'refund_images' directory
- Multiple images can be uploaded in a single request
- Each image creates a separate RefundOrderImage record

**File Requirements:**
- Must be valid image files
- Supported formats: JPG, PNG, GIF, etc.
- File size limits apply based on Django settings
- At least one image must be provided (images list cannot be empty)

**Request Format:**
- Use multipart/form-data
- order_id: integer
- images: array of image files

**Response:**
- Success: Returns list of uploaded images with their IDs and URLs
- Failure: Returns appropriate error message with details

value.message: This order is not assigned to you
Order is not in a valid status for uploading refund images
At least one image must be provided

get.description:
Get detailed information about a specific order for couriers.

**Access Control:**
- Couriers can only access orders that are either:
  - NEW orders (not attached to any courier)
  - Orders attached to this specific courier

**Response includes:**
- Order ID and basic information
- Complete delivery information (recipient, address, timing, etc.)
- Branch information (store details, location, images)
- Financial information (delivery fee, total amount, refund amount)
- Refund images (list of uploaded refund images with IDs and URLs)
- Detailed order items (products, quantities, returned quantities, prices, images)

**Use Cases:**
- View order details before accepting
- Get delivery instructions and recipient information
- Access product details and quantities
- Review financial information

404.description: Order not found or not accessible

get.description:
Retrieve the courier profile for the authenticated user.

**Features:**
- Returns complete courier profile information
- Includes user details (username, full name, email)
- Provides image URLs for uploaded documents
- Shows courier status and rating information
- Automatically creates profile if it doesn't exist

**Response Fields:**
- **id** - Courier profile ID
- **user_id** - User ID
- **username** - User's username
- **full_name** - User's full name
- **email** - User's email
- **phone_number** - User's phone number
- **avatar** - User's avatar image file path
- **avatar_url** - Full URL to user's avatar image
- **car_number** - Car number/plate
- **car_passport_number** - Car passport number
- **delivery_method** - Preferred delivery method (car, scooter, bike_or_foot)
- **driving_licence_number** - Driving licence number
- **driving_licence_image** - Driving licence image file path
- **driving_licence_image_url** - Full URL to driving licence image
- **car_front_image** - Car front image file path
- **car_front_image_url** - Full URL to car front image
- **car_back_image** - Car back image file path
- **car_back_image_url** - Full URL to car back image
- **courier_id** - Unique courier identifier
- **rating** - Courier rating (0-5)
- **is_online** - Online status
- **is_active** - Active status (admin controlled)
- **created_at** - Profile creation timestamp
- **updated_at** - Last update timestamp

put.summary: Get and update courier profile for the authenticated user
put.description:
This API allows couriers to view and update their profile information.
If the user doesn't have a courier profile, one will be created automatically.

patch.description:
Update the courier profile for the authenticated user.

**Updatable Fields:**
- **car_number** - Car number/plate
- **car_passport_number** - Car passport number
- **delivery_method** - Preferred delivery method (car, scooter, bike_or_foot)
- **driving_licence_number** - Driving licence number
- **driving_licence_image** - Driving licence image file
- **car_front_image** - Car front image file
- **car_back_image** - Car back image file
- **is_online** - Online status

**Auto-Generated Fields:**
- **courier_id** - Automatically generated based on delivery method:
  - Car delivery: Uses car_number as courier_id
  - Scooter/Bike delivery: Generated as COURIER001, COURIER002, etc.
- **rating** - Automatically calculated from customer reviews

**Business Rules:**
- Only authenticated users can update their own profile
- Delivery method must be one of the allowed choices
- Profile is created automatically if it doesn't exist
- Image files are uploaded to designated directories
- Rating is automatically calculated from customer reviews

**Validation:**
- All fields are optional for PATCH requests
- Invalid delivery methods are rejected
- File uploads are validated for image formats

delivery_method: Invalid delivery method. Must be one of: car, scooter, bike_or_foot

Retrieve a list of order review suggestions that can be used when clients

- Order by rating or ID

When a client is rating their delivery experience, this API provides
pre-written review suggestions based on the rating they select.

Create a review for a delivered order. This allows clients to rate
their delivery experience and provide feedback.

**Requirements:**
- Order must belong to the authenticated user
- Order must be in 'delivered' status

- Courier must be assigned to the order

- Returns all available location icons (no pagination)
- Includes icon URLs for easy access
- No authentication required (public endpoint)
- Ordered by creation date (newest first)

**Use Case**: Populate icon selection dropdown in location creation/update forms.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

get.description:
Retrieve all locations for the current authenticated user.

**Authentication Required**: This endpoint requires a valid JWT access token.

**Ordering**: Locations are ordered by:
1. Active location first (is_active=True)
2. Most recently created locations first

**Response**: Returns a list of user's saved locations with:
- Location details (title, address, coordinates)
- Delivery information (apartment, entrance, floor, door password)
- Location icon information (if selected)
- Active status and creation date

**Address Field**: The address field is automatically populated using reverse geocoding
when coordinates are provided during location creation or updates.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

post.description:
Create a new location for the current authenticated user.

**Authentication Required**: This endpoint requires a valid JWT access token.

**Required Fields**:
- `title`: Location name (e.g., "Home", "Office")
- `latitude`: GPS latitude coordinate
- `longitude`: GPS longitude coordinate

**Optional Fields**:
- `apartment`: Apartment number/letter
- `entrance`: Building entrance number
- `floor`: Floor number
- `door_password`: Door access code/password
- `location_icon`: ID of the location icon to use
- `address`: Address text (auto-filled from coordinates if not provided)

**Coordinate Validation**: Coordinates must be within Uzbekistan bounds.

**Address Auto-fill**: If coordinates are provided, the address field will be automatically
populated using reverse geocoding. You can override this by providing your own address.

get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific user location.

**Authentication Required**: This endpoint requires a valid JWT access token.

**Access Control**: Users can only access their own locations.

**Response**: Returns complete location information including:
- Location details (title, address, coordinates)
- Delivery information (apartment, entrance, floor, door password)
- Location icon information (if selected)
- Active status and creation date

delete.description:
Delete a specific user location.

**Authentication Required**: This endpoint requires a valid JWT access token.

**Functionality**: 
- Permanently deletes the specified user location
- Removes the location from the user's location list
- Cannot be undone

**Access Control**: Users can only delete their own locations.

**Important Notes**:
- If the deleted location was active, no other location will be automatically activated
- Users should ensure they have at least one location remaining for delivery purposes
- This operation cannot be undone

**Use Case**: Remove old or incorrect delivery addresses.

404.description: Q12`1Location not found or access denied

application/json.message: Location not found or access denied

put.description:
Update an existing user location with new information.

**Authentication Required**: This endpoint requires a valid JWT access token.

**Access Control**: Users can only update their own locations.

**Partial Update**: You can update only specific fields - all fields are optional.
Use PATCH for partial updates.

**Coordinate Updates**: If updating coordinates, they must be within Uzbekistan bounds.

patch.description:
Update an existing user location with new information.

**Authentication Required**: This endpoint requires a valid JWT access token.

**Access Control**: Users can only update their own locations.

**Partial Update**: You can update only specific fields - all fields are optional.
Use PATCH for partial updates.

**Coordinate Updates**: If updating coordinates, they must be within Uzbekistan bounds.
When coordinates are updated, the address field will be automatically updated using
reverse geocoding unless you explicitly provide a new address.

**Location Icon**: You can update the location icon by providing the icon ID.

post.description:
Activate a specific user location and deactivate all other locations for the user.

**Authentication Required**: This endpoint requires a valid JWT access token.

**Functionality**: 
- Sets the specified location as active (is_active=True)
- Deactivates all other user locations (is_active=False)
- Only one location can be active at a time

**Access Control**: Users can only activate their own locations.

**Use Case**: Set the primary delivery address for orders.

application/json.detail: Location not found or access denied.

post.description:
Add a product to user's cart. If the cart is empty or for a different branch, 
a new cart will be created. If adding to a different branch, the existing cart 
will be cleared first.

**Business Rules:**
- User can only have products from one branch in cart at a time
- If adding product from different branch, cart is automatically cleared
- Product must be available in the specified branch
- Sufficient inventory must be available
- Quantity must be greater than 0
- If product already exists in cart, quantity is REPLACED (not added to existing)

**Validation:**
- SKU must exist and be active
- Branch must exist and have the product
- Inventory must be sufficient

application/json.message: Product not available in this branch

post.description:
Remove all products from user's cart, effectively emptying it.

**Process:**
1. Find all cart items for the user
2. Delete all cart items
3. Delete the cart itself
4. Return confirmation message

**Note:** This action cannot be undone

get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about user's current cart.

**Returns:**
- Cart information (ID, branch, totals)
- List of all products with details
- Product images, prices, quantities
- Branch information
- Financial summary (subtotal, delivery fee, taxes, total)

**Note:** Returns empty cart if user has no active cart

post.description:
Remove a specific product from user's cart.

**Process:**
1. Find the product in user's cart
2. Remove the product completely
3. Update cart totals
4. Return updated cart summary

**Note:** This completely removes the product, not just reduces quantity

Update the quantity of a specific product in user's cart.

**Business Rules:**
- Quantity must be greater than 0
- If quantity is 0, product is removed from cart
- New quantity must not exceed available inventory
- Cart totals are automatically recalculated

**Process:**
1. Validate new quantity
2. Check inventory availability
3. Update quantity or remove if 0
4. Recalculate cart totals

Confirm a cart order and convert it to a confirmed order.

**Process:**
1. Validate cart has items and is in cart status
2. Process payment based on payment type (card or cash)
3. Update order with recipient and delivery information
4. Update existing UserLocation with new details (preserves coordinates)
5. Convert cart to confirmed order
6. Set estimated delivery time and time slot

**Payment Types:**
- **Card Payment**: Requires user_card_id, processes payment immediately
- **Cash Payment**: No card required, payment collected on delivery

**Security Features:**
- Cart ID in URL ensures users can only confirm their own specific cart
- User ownership validation prevents unauthorized access
- Only cart orders can be confirmed

**Features:**
- Dual payment support (card and cash)
- Payment processing with mock payment gateway (card only)
- Automatic UserLocation update (preserves coordinates)
- Order status conversion from cart to confirmed
- Custom delivery time and time slot support

**Important Notes:**
- Only cart orders can be confirmed
- Card payments must be successful to confirm order
- Cash payments are always successful (no payment processing)
- Users can only confirm their own carts
- Users must have an existing delivery address set
- Cannot create new locations during order confirmation (business rule)
- Only location details (apartment, floor, entrance, password) can be updated

get.description:
Retrieve comprehensive details of a specific order including all products, images, prices, and order information.

**Features:**
- Complete order information (status, dates, branch details)
- Detailed product list with images and prices
- Financial breakdown (subtotal, delivery fee, taxes, discounts, total)
- Delivery information (address, recipient details, comments)
- Payment information (method, status, date)
- Order timeline (creation, estimated delivery, actual delivery)

**Security:**
- Users can only view their own orders
- Order ID validation ensures proper access control
- Authentication required

**Response Includes:**
- Order metadata (ID, number, status, dates)
- Branch information (name, address, phone)
- Financial details (all amounts and fees)
- Delivery details (address, coordinates, apartment info)
- Recipient information (name, phone)
- Comments (for store and courier)
- Complete product list with images and pricing
- Payment information
- Order status and delivery tracking

404.description: Order not found or access denied

patch.description: Update the order status using the model's `update_status` method.

404.description: Order not found or access denied

get.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of user's orders with comprehensive filtering and ordering options.

**Features:**
- Filter by order status, date range, amount range, branch, and search terms
- Order by date, amount, creation time, or status
- Pagination support
- Detailed order information including items, branch details, and delivery info
- Automatic cart exclusion (configurable)

**Filtering Options:**
- **status**: Filter by specific order status (cart, pending, confirmed, etc.)
- **date_from/date_to**: Filter orders within date range
- **min_amount/max_amount**: Filter by total order amount
- **branch_id**: Filter orders from specific branch
- **search**: Search in order number, product names, or branch name
- **exclude_cart**: Whether to exclude cart orders (default: true)

**Ordering Options:**
- **-order_date**: Newest orders first (default)
- **order_date**: Oldest orders first
- **-total_amount**: Highest amount first
- **total_amount**: Lowest amount first
- **-created_at**: Recently created first
- **created_at**: Oldest created first
- **status**: Status A-Z
- **-status**: Status Z-A

**Response Includes:**
- Order details (ID, number, status, dates)
- Branch information (name, address)
- Financial summary (amounts, fees, discounts)
- Delivery information (address, recipient)
- Order items with product details and images
- Pagination metadata

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by order status

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.description: Filter orders from this date (YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.description: Filter orders until this date (YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: min_amount
parameters.description: Filter orders with minimum total amount

parameters.name: max_amount
parameters.description: Filter orders with maximum total amount

parameters.name: branch_id
parameters.description: Filter orders from specific branch

parameters.name: exclude_cart
parameters.description: Exclude cart orders (default: true)

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search in order number, product names, or branch name

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Ordering field for the results

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of items per page

get.description:
Retrieve a list of all payment cards associated with the authenticated user.

**Features:**
- Returns cards sorted by creation date (newest first)
- Includes card status (active/inactive, confirmed/unconfirmed)
- Shows masked card numbers for security
- Displays card type (Uzcard, Humo, Visa, Mastercard)

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

post.description:
Add a new payment card to user's account. This initiates SMS verification.

**Process:**
1. Submit card number and expiry date (MMYY format)
2. System validates and generates token
3. SMS code sent to registered phone
4. Use confirm_card API to complete registration

**Mock SMS Code:** `123456`

application/json.message: SMS verification code sent to your phone

post.description:
Confirm a payment card using SMS verification code.

**Process:**
1. Get card_token from add_card API
2. Enter SMS code received on phone
3. Card becomes active and ready for use

**Mock SMS Code:** `123456` (always works for testing)

application/json.message: Card successfully confirmed and ready for use.
Invalid SMS code. Please try again.

delete.description:
Delete a payment card from user's account.

**Security Features:**
- Only card owner can delete their cards
- Prevents deletion of cards with active payments
- Permanent deletion with confirmation message

**Process:**
1. Verify card ownership
2. Check for active/pending payments
3. Delete card if safe to remove
4. Return confirmation message

application/json.message: Uzcard card 8600 **** **** 1234 has been successfully deleted.
Cannot delete card with pending or active payments.
Card not found or you do not have permission to delete it.

get.description: Get most popular searches across all users

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of popular searches to return (max 50)

get.description:
Get a paginated list of user's product notes with associated notes details.

**Features:**
- Returns only the authenticated user's product notes
- Includes detailed information about associated notes
- Ordered by creation date (newest first)
- Paginated results for better performance
- Includes notes count and full notes data

**Use Cases:**
- Display user's shopping lists
- Show wish lists
- List recipe collections
- View product reminders

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of items per page

post.description:
Create a new product note with optional note texts.

**Features:**
- Creates a new user product note with a title
- Automatically creates NoteProduct instances for new note texts
- Reuses existing NoteProduct instances for duplicate note texts
- Associates all provided notes with the created product note

**Example Use Cases:**
- Shopping lists
- Wish lists
- Recipe ingredient lists
- Product reminders

get.description:
Get detailed information about a specific user product note.

**Features:**
- Returns complete details of a single product note
- Includes all associated notes with full details
- User can only access their own product notes
- Returns 404 if note doesn't exist or belongs to another user

**Use Cases:**
- View specific shopping list details
- Edit form data population
- Detailed note inspection

404.description: Product note not found or access denied

put.description:
Update a user product note title and/or associated notes.

**Features:**
- Updates the title if provided
- Replaces all existing notes with the provided note_texts list
- Creates new NoteProduct instances for new note texts
- Reuses existing NoteProduct instances for duplicate note texts
- Completely replaces the notes list (does not merge)

**Important:** This is a full update operation. All fields not provided will be reset to their default values.
Use PATCH for partial updates.

patch.description:
Partially update a user product note.

**Features:**
- Updates only the provided fields
- Leaves unchanged fields as they are
- Can update title only, notes only, or both
- When updating notes, completely replaces the existing notes list

**Examples:**
- Update only title: `{"title": "New Title"}`
- Update only notes: `{"note_texts": ["Item1", "Item2"]}`
- Update both: `{"title": "New Title", "note_texts": ["Item1", "Item2"]}`

delete.description:
Delete a user product note.

**Features:**
- Permanently deletes the user product note
- Removes the association between the note and its items
- Does NOT delete the associated NoteProduct instances (they can be reused)
- User can only delete their own product notes
- Returns 404 if note doesn't exist or belongs to another user

**Important:** This operation cannot be undone. The product note and its associations will be permanently removed.

404.description: Product note not found or access denied

get.description:
# üè™ Product List API - Complete Guide

Get a list of products available in nearby stores within the configured radius (10km).

## üéØ Key Features
- **üìç Location-based filtering** - Shows products from stores within 10km radius
- **üîÑ Automatic location activation** - Activates inactive location if provided
- **üí∞ Real-time pricing** - Live pricing and inventory from nearby stores
- **üìè Distance calculations** - Store distance and delivery info
- **üîç Comprehensive filtering** - Multiple filter options available
- **üì¶ Quantity filtering** - Shows only products with more than 1 quantity available
- **üéØ Main offer selection** - Smart offer selection based on branch_id, store_id, or cheapest price

## üìç Location Handling
- If `user_location_id` provided and location is **inactive** ‚Üí **automatically activated**
- Other user locations will be **deactivated** to maintain single active location
- If no `user_location_id` provided ‚Üí uses user's **currently active location**

## üéØ Main Offer Selection
The API now includes a `main_offer` field in each product response that shows the most relevant offer:

### **Priority Order:**
1. **`branch_id`** - If provided, shows offer from that specific branch
2. **`store_id`** - If provided, shows offer from that specific store/seller  
3. **Cheapest offer** - If no specific selection, shows cheapest available offer (with quantity > 0)

### **Main Offer Response:**
```json
{
  "main_offer": {
    "branch_id": 123,        // Branch ID (null if store-level or cheapest)
    "price": "25.50",        // Final price (sale_price or regular price)
    "quantity": 15           // Available quantity in that branch/store
  }
}
```

### **Use Cases:**
- **Branch-specific**: `?branch_id=123` ‚Üí Shows offer from branch 123
- **Store-specific**: `?store_id=456` ‚Üí Shows offer from store 456  
- **Best price**: No params ‚Üí Shows cheapest available offer

## üõ†Ô∏è Available Filters & Usage

### üìç **Location Parameters**
- `user_location_id` - Your location ID (activates if inactive)

### üè™ **Store & Product Filters**
- `store_id` - Filter by specific store/seller ID
- `has_discount` - Show only discounted products (true/false)
- `brand_id` - Filter by brand ID
- `category_id` - Filter by category (includes child categories)
- `from_price` - Minimum price filter
- `to_price` - Maximum price filter
- `saved_only` - Show only saved/favorite products (true/false)

### üîç **Search & Ordering**
- `search` - Search in product title, description, and SKU
- `ordering` - Sort results (see ordering options below)

## üìã Ordering Options

### üì¶ **Product Information**
- `product__title` - Product title (A-Z)
- `-product__title` - Product title (Z-A)

### üí∞ **Pricing**
- `base_price` - Price (low to high)
- `-base_price` - Price (high to low)

### üìä **Availability (NEW!)**
- `total_quantity` - Total available quantity (low to high)
- `-total_quantity` - Total available quantity (high to low) üî•

### üìÖ **Date**
- `created_at` - Oldest first
- `-created_at` - Newest first (default)

## üí° Usage Examples

### Basic Usage
```
GET /api/v1/products/list/?user_location_id=123
```

### Filter by Discount
```
GET /api/v1/products/list/?user_location_id=123&has_discount=true
```

### Filter by Brand + Price Range
```
GET /api/v1/products/list/?user_location_id=123&brand_id=456&from_price=100&to_price=500
```

### Order by Quantity (Most Available First)
```
GET /api/v1/products/list/?user_location_id=123&ordering=-total_quantity
```

### Combined Filters + Search
```
GET /api/v1/products/list/?user_location_id=123&category_id=101&has_discount=true&search=iPhone&ordering=-total_quantity
```

### Show Saved Products Only
```
GET /api/v1/products/list/?user_location_id=123&saved_only=true
```

### Show Products from Specific Branch (with main_offer)
```
GET /api/v1/products/list/?user_location_id=123&branch_id=456
```

### Show Products from Specific Store (with main_offer)
```
GET /api/v1/products/list/?user_location_id=123&store_id=789
```

### Show Cheapest Available Products (main_offer = cheapest)
```
GET /api/v1/products/list/?user_location_id=123&ordering=-total_quantity
```

## üìä Response Structure
Returns paginated results with:
- **Product details** (title, description, images)
- **Pricing info** (base price, discounts, final price)
- **Store information** (distance, delivery fee, operating hours)
- **Availability** (stock quantity, status)
- **Main offer** (branch_id, price, quantity) - Smart offer selection
- **Metadata** (user location, applied filters, store radius)

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: üîç **Search Query** - Search across product title, description, and SKU. Example: `iPhone` finds all iPhone products

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description:
üìã **Sort Results** - Order products by specified field. Use `-` prefix for descending order.

**üì¶ Product Information:**
- `product__title` - Sort by title A-Z
- `-product__title` - Sort by title Z-A

**üí∞ Pricing:**
- `base_price` - Sort by price (low to high)
- `-base_price` - Sort by price (high to low)

**üìä Availability (NEW!):**
- `total_quantity` - Sort by quantity (low to high)
- `-total_quantity` - Sort by quantity (high to low) üî•

**üìÖ Date:**
- `created_at` - Sort by oldest first
- `-created_at` - Sort by newest first (default)

**üí° Popular Examples:**
- `-total_quantity` - Most available products first
- `-base_price` - Most expensive first
- `product__title` - Alphabetical order

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: user_location_id
parameters.description: üìç **User Location ID** - Your saved location ID. If this location is inactive, it will be automatically activated and other locations will be deactivated. Example: `123`

parameters.name: is_top
parameters.description: ‚≠ê **Top Products Filter** - Show only products marked as top in the store/branch. Use with `store_id` or `branch_id` to filter for specific store/branch. Example: `true`

parameters.name: store_id
parameters.description: üè™ **Store Filter** - Filter products by specific store/seller ID. Only shows products available from this store. Also sets the main_offer to show offer from this store. Example: `456`

parameters.name: branch_id
parameters.description: üè™ **Branch Filter** - Filter products by specific branch ID. Also sets the main_offer to show offer from this branch. Example: `123`

parameters.name: has_discount
parameters.description: üí∏ **Discount Filter** - Show only products with active discounts. Set to `true` to see discounted items only, `false` for non-discounted, or omit for all products.

parameters.name: brand_id
parameters.description: üè∑Ô∏è **Brand Filter** - Filter products by brand ID. Shows all products from the specified brand. Example: `789` for Apple products

parameters.name: category_id
parameters.description: üìÇ **Category Filter** - Filter by category ID. **Includes all child categories automatically**. Example: `101` for Electronics (includes Smartphones, Laptops, etc.)

parameters.name: from_price
parameters.description: üí∞ **Minimum Price** - Filter products with price >= this value. Use with `to_price` for price range. Example: `50.00`

parameters.name: to_price
parameters.description: üí∞ **Maximum Price** - Filter products with price <= this value. Use with `from_price` for price range. Example: `500.00`

parameters.name: saved_only
parameters.description: üíæ **Saved Products Only** - Show only products that the user has saved to their favorites. Set to `true` to see saved products only. Example: `true`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: üìÑ **Page Number** - Pagination page number (starts from 1). Combine with `page_size` if supported. Example: `2` for second page

200.description: ‚úÖ **Success Response** - Product list retrieved successfully with all requested filters applied

401.description: üîí **Authentication Required** - Valid JWT token required in Authorization header

404.description: üìç **Location Not Found** - User location not found or access denied

get.summary: üì¶ Offer Detail API - Comprehensive Product Information
get.description:
# üè™ Offer Detail API - Complete Guide

Get detailed information about a specific product offer/SKU with comprehensive data.

## üéØ Key Features
- **üì¶ Complete product information** - Title, description, category, brand, tags
- **üñºÔ∏è Product images** - Both product and SKU-specific images
- **üìã Specifications** - General product specs and SKU-specific specs
- **üîÑ Product variants** - Other SKUs of the same product with structured options
- **üé® Product options** - Structured option types (Color, Storage, etc.) with available values
- **üîó Variant combinations** - All possible variant combinations with pricing and images
- **üéØ Current variant** - Currently selected variant with its options
- **üè™ Store offers** - All stores offering this product with pricing
- **üìç Location-based** - Distance calculations and store information
- **üìä Availability** - Real-time stock information from all stores
- **üéØ Main offer selection** - Select specific offer or branch, or get cheapest

## üìç Location Handling
- Uses user's **currently active location** for distance calculations
- Shows store distance and delivery information
- Sorts offers by distance (nearest first)

## üéØ Main Offer Selection
- **offer_id** - Select specific offer by ID
- **branch_id** - Select offer from specific branch
- **Auto-selection** - If no selection, shows cheapest available offer

## üõ†Ô∏è Available Parameters

### üìç **Main Offer Selection**
- `offer_id` - Specific offer ID to highlight as main offer
- `branch_id` - Branch ID to find offer from that branch

## üìä Response Structure

### üì¶ **Product Information**
- **Basic details**: Title, description, SKU, category, brand
- **Images**: Product images and SKU-specific images
- **Tags**: Product tags and categories

### üìã **Specifications**
- **Product specifications**: General specs that apply to all variants
- **SKU specifications**: Specific specs for this variant only

### üîÑ **Product Variants**
- **Other variants**: All other SKUs of the same product with structured options
- **Pricing**: Min/max prices for each variant
- **Availability**: Store count and stock status

### üé® **Product Options**
- **Option types**: Structured options like Color, Storage, etc.
- **Available values**: All possible values for each option type
- **Option metadata**: Display names and availability status

### üîó **Variant Combinations**
- **All combinations**: Complete list of all possible variant combinations
- **Option mapping**: Each variant's specific option values
- **Pricing per variant**: Individual pricing for each combination
- **Images per variant**: Variant-specific images
- **Current selection**: Highlighted current variant

### üéØ **Current Variant**
- **Selected variant**: Currently viewed variant information
- **Option values**: Specific options for the current variant
- **Selection status**: Indicates this is the current selection

### üéØ **Main Offer**
- **Selected offer**: Based on offer_id, branch_id, or cheapest
- **Pricing**: Original price, sale price, discount percentage
- **Store info**: Distance, delivery fee, operating hours
- **Availability**: Stock quantity and status

### üè™ **Store Offers**
- **Available offers**: Only offers with stock > 0
- **Pricing**: Original price, sale price, discount percentage
- **Store info**: Distance, delivery fee, operating hours
- **Availability**: Stock quantity per store

## üí° Usage Examples

### Basic Usage
```
GET /api/v1/products/offers/{sku_id}/
```

### Select Specific Offer
```
GET /api/v1/products/offers/{sku_id}/?offer_id=123
```

### Select Offer from Branch
```
GET /api/v1/products/offers/{sku_id}/?branch_id=456
```

### Example Response
```json
{
  "id": 789,
  "sku": "IPHONE-16-PRO-128GB-BLACK",
  "product_title": "iPhone 16 Pro",
  "product_description": "Latest iPhone model with A18 Bionic chip...",
  "category": {
    "id": 101,
    "title": "Smartphones",
    "slug": "smartphones"
  },
  "brand": {
    "id": 456,
    "title": "Apple",
    "slug": "apple"
  },
  "tags": [
    {"id": 1, "title": "Premium", "slug": "premium"},
    {"id": 2, "title": "5G", "slug": "5g"}
  ],
  "product_images": [...],
  "sku_images": [...],
  "product_specifications": [
    {"name": "Processor", "value": "A18 Bionic"},
    {"name": "Display", "value": "6.9-inch OLED"}
  ],
  "sku_specifications": [
    {"name": "Storage", "value": "128GB"},
    {"name": "Color", "value": "Black Titanium"}
  ],
  "product_options": {
    "Color": {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "Color",
      "display_name": "Color",
      "type": "select",
      "values": [
        {"id": 1, "value": "Black", "display_name": "Black", "is_available": true},
        {"id": 2, "value": "White", "display_name": "White", "is_available": true},
        {"id": 3, "value": "Blue", "display_name": "Blue", "is_available": true}
      ]
    },
    "Storage": {
      "id": 2,
      "name": "Storage",
      "display_name": "Storage",
      "type": "select",
      "values": [
        {"id": 4, "value": "128GB", "display_name": "128GB", "is_available": true},
        {"id": 5, "value": "256GB", "display_name": "256GB", "is_available": true},
        {"id": 6, "value": "512GB", "display_name": "512GB", "is_available": true}
      ]
    }
  },
  "variant_combinations": [
    {
      "id": 789,
      "sku": "IPHONE-16-PRO-128GB-BLACK",
      "title": "iPhone 16 Pro IPHONE-16-PRO-128GB-BLACK",
      "options": {
        "Color": {"id": 1, "value": "Black", "display_name": "Black"},
        "Storage": {"id": 4, "value": "128GB", "display_name": "128GB"}
      },
      "images": [...],
      "min_price": "999.00",
      "max_price": "1099.00",
      "has_discount": true,
      "is_current": true,
      "is_available": true
    },
    {
      "id": 790,
      "sku": "IPHONE-16-PRO-256GB-WHITE",
      "title": "iPhone 16 Pro IPHONE-16-PRO-256GB-WHITE",
      "options": {
        "Color": {"id": 2, "value": "White", "display_name": "White"},
        "Storage": {"id": 5, "value": "256GB", "display_name": "256GB"}
      },
      "images": [...],
      "min_price": "1099.00",
      "max_price": "1199.00",
      "has_discount": true,
      "is_current": false,
      "is_available": true
    }
  ],
  "current_variant": {
    "id": 789,
    "sku": "IPHONE-16-PRO-128GB-BLACK",
    "title": "iPhone 16 Pro IPHONE-16-PRO-128GB-BLACK",
    "options": {
      "Color": {"id": 1, "value": "Black", "display_name": "Black"},
      "Storage": {"id": 4, "value": "128GB", "display_name": "128GB"}
    },
    "is_current": true
  },
  "other_variants": [
    {
      "id": 790,
      "sku": "IPHONE-16-PRO-256GB-WHITE",
      "product_title": "iPhone 16 Pro",
      "variant_options": {
        "Color": {"id": 2, "value": "White", "display_name": "White"},
        "Storage": {"id": 5, "value": "256GB", "display_name": "256GB"}
      },
      "min_price": "1099.00",
      "max_price": "1199.00",
      "has_discount": true
    }
  ],
  "min_price": "999.00",
  "max_price": "1099.00",
  "has_discount": true,
  "available_stores_count": 3,
  "total_availability": {
    "in_stock": true,
    "total_quantity": 45,
    "status": "in_stock"
  },
  "main_offer": {
    "id": 1,
    "price": "1099.00",
    "sale_price": "999.00",
    "has_discount": true,
    "discount_percentage": 9.1,
    "final_price": "999.00",
    "is_featured": true,
    "store_info": {
      "id": 1,
      "seller_name": "TechStore Tashkent",
      "store_name": "TechStore Mega Planet",
      "address": "Mega Planet Mall, Tashkent",
      "distance": 2.5,
      "distance_formatted": "2.5km",
      "delivery_fee": "5.00",
      "estimated_delivery_time": 30,
      "is_open": true
    },
    "availability": {
      "in_stock": true,
      "quantity": 25,
      "status": "in_stock"
    }
  },
  "offers": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "price": "1099.00",
      "sale_price": "999.00",
      "has_discount": true,
      "discount_percentage": 9.1,
      "final_price": "999.00",
      "is_featured": true,
      "store_info": {
        "id": 1,
        "seller_name": "TechStore Tashkent",
        "distance": 2.5,
        "distance_formatted": "2.5km",
        "delivery_fee": "5.00",
        "estimated_delivery_time": 30,
        "is_open": true
      },
      "availability": {
        "in_stock": true,
        "quantity": 25,
        "status": "in_stock"
      }
    }
  ]
}
```

## üîß Business Logic

### Main Offer Selection
- **offer_id priority**: If provided, selects that specific offer
- **branch_id priority**: If provided, selects offer from that branch
- **Auto-selection**: If no selection, shows cheapest available offer
- **Availability check**: Only shows offers with stock > 0

### Product Variants
- Shows all active SKUs of the same product
- Excludes the current SKU being viewed
- Includes pricing and availability for each variant

### Store Offers
- Shows only offers with stock > 0
- Calculates distance from user location
- Sorts by distance (nearest first)
- Includes availability per store

### Specifications
- **Product specs**: General specifications (processor, display, etc.)
- **SKU specs**: Variant-specific specs (storage, color, etc.)

### Pricing
- **Min price**: Lowest price across all stores
- **Max price**: Highest price across all stores
- **Discount calculation**: Percentage off original price

parameters.name: offer_id
parameters.description: üéØ **Main Offer Selection** - Specific offer ID to highlight as main offer. If provided, this offer will be shown as the main offer regardless of price or distance.

parameters.name: branch_id
parameters.description: üè™ **Branch Selection** - Branch ID to find offer from that specific branch. If provided, the offer from this branch will be shown as the main offer.

200.description: ‚úÖ **Success Response** - Offer details retrieved successfully with main offer selection

401.description: üîí **Authentication Required** - Valid JWT token required in Authorization header

404.description: ‚ùå **Not Found** - SKU product not found or inactive

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A unique integer value identifying this SKU Product.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

post.description: Add a product to user's saved list

notes.description: Optional notes for the saved product

400.description: Product already saved or invalid data

delete.description: Remove a product from user's saved list

204.description: Product removed from saved list successfully

get.description: Get user's search history (last 15 queries)

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of search history items to return (max 15)

post.description: Add a new search query to user's history

delete.description: Clear all search history for the authenticated user
Delete a specific search history item

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A unique integer value identifying this Search History.

post.summary: Search products by multiple note queries.

get.description:
# üìÇ Seller Categories List API

Get a list of all available seller categories with their icons and seller counts.

## üéØ Features
- **üìÇ Category listing** - All available seller categories
- **üñºÔ∏è Category icons** - Icons for each category
- **üìä Seller counts** - Number of sellers in each category
- **üîç No pagination** - Complete list in single response
- **üåê Public access** - No authentication required

## üìä Response Fields
- **id** - Category unique identifier
- **title** - Category name/title
- **icon** - Category icon file path
- **icon_url** - Full URL to category icon
- **sellers_count** - Number of sellers in this category
- **created_at** - Category creation timestamp
- **updated_at** - Category last update timestamp

## üí° Usage Examples

### Basic Usage
```
GET /api/v1/stores/categories/
```

### Response Example
```json
[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "title": "Supermarkets",
    "icon": "/media/images/supermarket_icon.png",
    "icon_url": "https://example.com/media/images/supermarket_icon.png",
    "sellers_count": 15,
    "created_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z",
    "updated_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z"
  },
  {
    "id": 2,
    "title": "Restaurants",
    "icon": "/media/images/restaurant_icon.png",
    "icon_url": "https://example.com/media/images/restaurant_icon.png",
    "sellers_count": 8,
    "created_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z",
    "updated_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z"
  }
]
```

## üîó Related APIs
- **Nearby Stores**: Use category IDs to filter nearby stores
- **Store Details**: Get detailed information about stores in categories

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term.

get.description:
# üè™ Nearby Stores API

Get stores with location-based filtering for authenticated users or all stores for unauthenticated users.

## üéØ Features
- **üîê Authentication-based behavior** - Different behavior for authenticated vs unauthenticated users
- **üìç Location-based filtering** - Shows stores within configured radius (authenticated users only)
- **üìÇ Category filtering** - Filter stores by seller category
- **üîÑ One store per seller** - Shows only one store for each seller
- **üìè Distance calculation** - Real-time distance from your location (authenticated users only)
- **üïê Operating hours** - Current store availability
- **üöö Delivery info** - Delivery fees and estimated times
- **üñºÔ∏è Store images** - Branch images with seller logo fallback
- **üìä Category information** - Seller category details for each store

## üîê Authentication Behavior

### üîë Authenticated Users (with active location)
- **Location-based filtering** - Shows stores within configured radius
- **Distance calculation** - Real-time distance from user's active location
- **Sorted by distance** - Nearest stores first
- **One nearest store per seller** - Shows closest branch for each seller

### üåê Unauthenticated Users
- **All stores returned** - No location or radius restrictions
- **No distance calculation** - Distance fields return `null`
- **One store per seller** - Shows first available branch for each seller
- **Category filtering still works** - Can filter by category_id

## üìç Location Requirements (Authenticated Users Only)
- User must have an **active location** set
- Location must have valid **latitude and longitude**
- Uses **currently active location** automatically

## üîç Query Parameters
- **category_id** (optional) - Filter stores by seller category ID
  - Use category IDs from `/api/v1/stores/categories/` endpoint
  - Example: `?category_id=1` to show only supermarkets
  - Works for both authenticated and unauthenticated users

## üìä Response Fields
- **id** - Store branch unique identifier
- **seller_name** - Store/seller name
- **seller_category** - Seller category title (e.g., "Supermarkets")
- **seller_category_id** - Seller category ID for filtering
- **store_name** - Branch/store name
- **address** - Store address
- **store_image** - Store image (branch image first, seller image fallback)
- **seller_logo** - Seller logo/brand image
- **distance** - Formatted distance (e.g., "150 –º.") - `null` for unauthenticated users
- **distance_meters** - Distance in meters (integer) - `null` for unauthenticated users
- **delivery_time_formatted** - Delivery time range (e.g., "20-30 daqiqa")
- **operating_hours** - Store hours (e.g., "08:00 - 22:00")
- **is_open_now** - Whether store is currently open
- **delivery_fee** - Delivery fee amount
- **is_open** - Store open status

## üí° Usage Examples

### Unauthenticated User (All Stores)
```
GET /api/v1/stores/nearby/
```

### Unauthenticated User (Filtered by Category)
```
GET /api/v1/stores/nearby/?category_id=1
```

### Authenticated User (Location-based)
```
GET /api/v1/stores/nearby/
Authorization: Bearer <token>
```

### Response Example (Authenticated User)
```json
[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "seller_name": "Makro Supermarket",
    "seller_category": "Supermarkets",
    "seller_category_id": 1,
    "store_name": "Makro Minor",
    "address": "Minor district, Tashkent",
    "store_image": "https://example.com/branch/image.jpg",
    "seller_logo": "https://example.com/seller/logo.jpg",
    "distance": "150 –º.",
    "distance_meters": 150,
    "delivery_time_formatted": "20-30 daqiqa",
    "operating_hours": "08:00 - 22:00",
    "is_open_now": true,
    "delivery_fee": "5.00",
    "is_open": true
  }
]
```

### Response Example (Unauthenticated User)
```json
[
  {
    "id": 1,
    "seller_name": "Makro Supermarket",
    "seller_category": "Supermarkets",
    "seller_category_id": 1,
    "store_name": "Makro Minor",
    "address": "Minor district, Tashkent",
    "store_image": "https://example.com/branch/image.jpg",
    "seller_logo": "https://example.com/seller/logo.jpg",
    "distance": null,
    "distance_meters": null,
    "delivery_time_formatted": "20-30 daqiqa",
    "operating_hours": "08:00 - 22:00",
    "is_open_now": true,
    "delivery_fee": "5.00",
    "is_open": true
  }
]
```

## üîó Related APIs
- **Seller Categories**: `/api/v1/stores/categories/` - Get available categories
- **User Locations**: Set active location for distance calculation (authenticated users)

## ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration
- **Store Radius**: Configured in `STORE_RADIUS_KM` setting (default: 10.0km) - authenticated users only
- **Distance Format**: Automatically formatted for display - authenticated users only
- **Image Priority**: Branch image ‚Üí Seller image ‚Üí None
- **Category Filtering**: Invalid category IDs are ignored
- **Authentication**: No authentication required, but behavior differs based on auth status

200.description: Success - Returns all stores for unauthenticated users or nearby stores for authenticated users
